Ratings.comment: Blatant lack of regard and empathy for students which is masked by politeness and professionalism. Insane load of work that makes this class feel like it should count for almost twice the credits it offers. She is a sweet person, but her kindness does not peek through at all in her profession. Would not recommend taking her courses.

Dr. Kim is so incredibly passionate about her field and is very understanding. Not only this but her lectures are genuinely informative. She's super nice, but is pretty strict about what she wants in an assignment and has high standards. Honestly, the only bad thing about this class is the amount of reading and writing, it's a LOT.

I do not recommend this class unless it is required for your major/minor. As someone who took 17 credit hours, this class felt like 10 of them. The workload was large and the reading assignments were too hefty to complete in a single night. Prof. Kim is a nice person but her class is not very enjoyable for those who are not passionate about arts.

Dr. Kim is a truly caring instructor, that wants her students to succeed more than anything. While the course has a heavy reading load, she is always open to communication, and is understanding of circumstances. She is an outstanding instructor that cares about the class material, and has plenty of availability outside of class for extra help.

- 2 essays every week
- bad communicator
- no specific explanation of the rubric for any assignments
- bad time management (always on a time crunch)
- very few graded assignments (others went in as complete/0)

I understand it was her first year, but her teaching/class style was extremely hard to follow. Every other day you have to write 500 word essay for 0 points and there's only 5 real grades for the semester, 4 of which are group assignments. Her grading was extremely flawed and unequal to all group members. She is not understanding or compassionate.

Dr. Miller was such a sweeheart! She cares a lot about her students and always offers insightful feedback and discussion. Class is very discussion based and there are a few group projects. There is a bit of reading but she usually provides the material, I only had to purchase on book that was very cheap for the whole semester.

Dr. Miller was such a sweetheart! Class is very discussion based and there are a few group projects. Her class does require a book but it is super cheap and easy to access. Attendance is mandatory and the class is very interesting and she is a very thoughtful and insightful teacher.

Very very nice. The class was really interesting and engaging and Professor Miller always had thoughtful feedback. Participation and attendance are so so important though so don't take it if you can't be there (but it's a great class so I don't know why you wouldn't go!)
I loved professor Miller. She is very kind and understanding. You can tell she really cares about her students and the material she is teaching. 10/10 would recommend.

I took three classes with him. loved how he teaches. I learned so much, and he is just truly amazing. 201 can be challenging if you are new to Chinese. 331 is so fun and practical. 334 is taught in English and many readings. I loved all three. He is in Wheaton, but he is leaving, so plz take his class now. he is my fav prof. Chen laoshi we love you
Chen Laoshi is very kind and really helps students improve. Be ready for lots of work though!
I've never taken an individual classroom track before, but Chen Laoshi made is really fun! Seriously, take his class. He is the voice of reason amidst the sea of bad professors.
Chen laoshi is the best! He grades about the same as all of the other Chinese TA's. He's really fun as long as students are prepared. Extremely nice.
